title: Don't constantly take raptors and wolves from your jungler
body:
And then proceed to ask questions like

Why is my jungler so useless??

HMMM Maybe because your counterjungling your own jungler and making them behind on lvls and gold

replies.body: Just by these comments show how much salty laners blame everything on the jg. As a Susan main, I never take farm from my jg.
A susan main that never takes jungle, a rare species
When I play Nasus I always steal the small wolves and small raptors

And then when you're behind in lane you wonder why I don't show up.

I will literally let you take them half the time if you just ask if you can. If you're going to take parts of my jungle, I'll either not gank, or I'll take even more tax to compensate. You'll make even less stacks in the process.

I leave the big ones which are majority of the gold, experience and have the smite buff. You shouldn't get mad at me for casually stealing a small raptor for 3 stacks. Be happy I'm not afk top. Also I don't expect more than one jungle gank as Nasus anyway. Gank me at most once before 6 to alleviate kill pressure, then go get some drags while the enemy jungler camps me or ignores top.

Or how about ask first.  The jungler gets more gold and experience and you are missing more stacks then you are trying to gain so really you hurting the entire team.  Jungles have a very fine line to walk early game to keep up with the game.
hey I'd even let you take the big one too if you ask nicely :P
Or maybe because you don't have good efficient routes to make sure you never get behind and help out your laners. It is always your fault btw not anybody else's you need to look for your mistakes.
Lol plz
You can get lvl 6 with 6 minutes on aoe junglers. 7:30 on even the slowest. After that, wolves and raptors don't mean shit. It's all about buff, dragon, RH, and scuttle control.

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=63va5ffs,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-02-11T23:04:04.280+0000)
>
> You can get lvl 6 with 6 minutes on aoe junglers. 7:30 on even the slowest. After that, wolves and raptors don't mean shit. It's all about buff, dragon, RH, and scuttle control.

Yeah, the free unkillable ward in blue side jungle and the free guaranteed sweepers are useless post 6.

Gromp and Krugs don't have vision based smite buffs, take those all you want. Let the jungler keep his map control.
Compared to scuttle? Yes, they are useless. Scuttle is what allows you to contest/dominate baron/dragon.

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=63va5ffs,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-11T23:13:45.960+0000)
>
> Compared to scuttle? Yes, they are useless. Scuttle is what allows you to contest/dominate baron/dragon.

No. Contesting dragon and Baron isn't the key to dragon and baron control. The key is being in the river 30-40 seconds before dragon spawns, setting up wards over the wall and killing it faster than your opponent can react.

Also playing Nunu. You never lose a dragon as Nunu.
What is more important: a free ward at the blue/gwamp junction or a free ward and speed shrine at dragon/baron?

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=63va5ffs,comment-id=0000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-11T23:21:50.986+0000)
>
> What is more important: a free ward at the blue/gwamp junction or a free ward and speed shrine at dragon/baron?

Guess what, the JUNGLER doesn't have to kill Scuttle to get that shrine. 

If mid laners want to poach camps, take Scuttle! By all means. But unless you're running Smite you are literally making our map darker by taking wolves.
Fun fact, it patrols the entire blue quadrant of the jungle, if you don't see it move you have effectively lit up 25% of the map because you know they aren't there.

My jng route with my only jng({{champion:33}}):
1. start at krugs
2. go take that red
3. raptors,
4. wolves,
5. then blue,
6.then gromp.
 I always have a good amount of health left over. so I look for someone overextending, immediately gank then take the scuttle and back.
How else do I stack my devourer on mid lane garen.
Kill the enemy mid a lot. You're mid-lane Garen, you're clearly unstoppable.

by looking at dos post i realize why i always get jungle when i have another role maybe top or mid as primary.


these guys dont ever play jungle and think wr are just supports who walk around the map.
More like slaves, I feel like if any lane is losing, they start throwing insults at me even if im the reason my team is overall winning the game.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

in those guys' eyes, supports are slaves for the adc, and jg are slaves for everybody.

and yet jg was designed as a individual role which farms the jungle monsters so no resources of the map will be wasted, before they had a jungler they used to have duo top which means the jg monsters were just sitting there.


**JG was meant to be a solo "lane" not responsible for any other lanes**

I absolutely hate when people think the support is supposed to babysit the ADC all game. If the ADC got fed then the support has done their laning job but a support is meant to help THE WHOLE TEAM. I had a Vayne complain to my Lulu for not ulting her in a team fight. Why the hell would I give a Vayne bonus hp when the Cho or Xin engaging obviously needs it more?
ADC are selfish people, they want everything for themselves, very sick of ADC losing lane then started roaming around stealing cs because "I have no tower to fall back to"
If the adc loses the lane go top and kite the hell out of that Darius.
not when my garen is free farming top forcing darius back and u just goes up and steal his farm leaving ur support getting towerdived 1v2.
lol Vayne with less or more hp. Whats the difference. But cho becomes literally godzilla.

> [{quoted}](name=FortisDominus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=63va5ffs,comment-id=000e0000,timestamp=2016-02-12T05:18:16.124+0000)
>
> More like slaves, I feel like if any lane is losing, they start throwing insults at me even if im the reason my team is overall winning the game.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Huh mate....I feel your pain. I remember a few days ago when I played Nocturne jungle, my top laner died at level 2 before I killed blue buff and 2nd time when I went back to base after my 1st clear because Rengar found me and almost killed me so 8 couldn't gank at lvl 3. He started to flame me and did it untill the end of the game. He was 1-5 Morde top vs 5-1 Wukong and was ~3 levels behind. When I told him that that Wukong is probably going to kill us both If i gank considering that my Morde was constantly on 30%hp while Kong was always full he asked enemy team to report me for trolling.
hes taxing my lane so i tax his jungle
Look at your jungler's 70 farm, then look at your 170, and then decide if you are still going to be an asshole by taking his only reliable source of gold and exp income.
Jungle camps give about x4 the amount of gold from minions, sooooo
but they are not a very steady source of income
It's really the worst when my team is behind and they keep taking wolves. I can light up an entire fourth of the map, but they can't wait for me to smite...
Gets even better when your trying to get sated and they get mad at you for not getting sated by 18:00~. Really makes my day.
As someone who plays jungle pretty regularly, all I allow is taking the small raptors from over the wall early on. Anything past that is really annoying.

the chicken or the egg?

jg made useless because greedy lanes took camps
or
lanes took camps in place of the farm they lost because jg was being useless
Your lane, your job. I'm here for objective control and giving you an advantage over your opponents, not to make up for the bullshit you do in your lane.

Objective control is your job. so, you're saying you always take dragon by yourself? Because, tbh, I never factor in jungle giving any advantage into winning lane, and literally every person is trying to get the team an advantage in mid and late game.  So, what? you carry smite, still need teammates for objective control and yet you are against the idea of the mutual making up for shortcomings as an aspect of teamwork?

idc. just don't stand there like you're about to gank. I don't want to mistakenly factor you in to my actions

No, that's not what I'm saying. The problem is when there are people who constantly take stuff like raptors and/or wolves, especially if it's not communicated and with the laners thinking of their jungler. Especially when there are people who lose their lane hard it often becomes alot harder to pull off ganks due to more roaming, enemies you can't kill with the laner alone etc.
I've had it way too often that 2 people lose their lanes and suddenly start farming jungle camps on a regaular basis, while denying the best jungle monster buffs for their jungler. As long as there is a laning phase and people are more or less low level it can hurt your jungler quite bad. If bot takes krugs and mid raptors my jungle clear is way more ineffective. 
Laners get "free exp" with each minion wave coming to their lane, while the jungler needs his camps to get exp and he takes a risk by trying to gank a lane. If it doesn't work out or you realize that it's all warded the jungler loses exp and has no other way to make up for it than by clearing jungle camps.
Especially if you lose your lane it generally isn't a good idea to concentrate on ganking thise lane or giving lots of gold/exp to this laner by letting him take your jungle camps, it's better to push those who do good or who are even with their opponents so those guys (and possibly even the jungler) can carry and boost their powerspikes. A completely mediocre team will most likely lose against a team with 1-2 people fed and 1-2 people behind.

In mid-game things are changing, but randomly taking away important smite buffs and camps from your jungler in the earlier stages, will most likely hurt you and your team more than it may benefit you.

Thank you for making the point about ganks.  When we go for a gank we are losing experience waiting for the moment.  If the moment doesn't come for bout 45 seconds we need to bail.  If the moment comes even second after that then oh well.  We lost a lot of time and gold and we need to keep the big buffs secured.
so its my fault you lost YOUR lane? and so im being punished because YOU suck? I mean when i have my mid laner taking my jungle camps i just go to his lane and take his farm so it balances out.
Seems fair. I'm going to start doing this.
Shit, i tell my jg to "collect their tax". Or babysit lane getting few cs and some xp.
However, if your enemy laner isn't around in mid- feel free to fire a bit of AoE over the wraith camp to steal some of the enemy jungler farm. Every bit helps :D
Not a bad idea at all.

Laners threat junglers like 2nd category role, best would be if jungler was ganking 24/7 and giving everything to others.
Lane minions belongs to laners but whats in jungle belongs to.. everyone? Mids takes blue, adcs red, and everyone else whats left, but god forbid if a jungler taxes minion or two.

As someone who mained top lane for a good while, only issue I have with junlgers Taxing is disrupting wave manipulation. Most of the time junglers don't understand what that is or don't care about it. 
I is incredibly frustrating to have a wave frozen right outside of your tower only to have a jungler gank, successfully or not, and ruin my biggest advantage i had over my lane. 

I'm not saying you can't tax my lane if you gank get a flash or even a kill, but for the betterment of the team learn how to keep a wave frozen and don't just blindly AA the minions down to collect your tax. Your gank doesn't do me any good if I have to return to lane against a riven or jax and have to farm at their turret now, it just sets me up for my turn to get ganked.
The entire reason I don't tax summed up pretty well. I don't understand wave control, therefore I don't touch wave control.

> [{quoted}](name=DrathTurtle314,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=63va5ffs,comment-id=001900010000,timestamp=2016-02-12T16:04:35.091+0000)
>
> The entire reason I don't tax summed up pretty well. I don't understand wave control, therefore I don't touch wave control.

same. I never tax. The only exception is if a laner is taxing my jungle, I main(ed) sion jungle so I took enough minions to compensate for the missed hp.

While I agree with you, (and am guilty of taking little raptors every so often because so easy with 1 syndra Q from lane, cant resist) 

If i have a jungler who is going sated and continually refuses to take rift herald when possible because "Rift herald sucks" 

You better believe I will be taking raptors or wolves  when ever I have a second of empty time.
